definition: knight/swordsman/noble warrior/chivalrous hero
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
knight-errant/brave and chivalrous/hero/heroic

sentences.english: Qin Dynasty of"moxa Xiao sleet is an arc hand, way, " big Xia's returning is actually a merchant to forget more matter.
sentences.chinese: 艾曉雪一拱手，道，“秦朝大俠還真是貴人多忘事啊。

sentences.english: Master Oogway will now choose  the Dragon Warrior!
sentences.chinese: 烏龜大師現在將選出神龍大俠。

sentences.english: I just wanted to see  who the Dragon Warrior was.
sentences.chinese: 我就是想看看誰是神龍大俠。

sentences.english: What is the secret of Viper?
sentences.chinese: 靈蛇大俠成功的祕訣是什麼呢？

sentences.english: I sense the Dragon Warrior is among us.
sentences.chinese: 我感覺到神龍大俠就在我們中間。

sentences.english: Art shook his head, the side of the quake Why do all this reform and then exacting.
sentences.chinese: 大俠搖頭，那邊的咔咔咋都那麼苛磣呢。

sentences.english: And then the Dragon warrior joined the Furious five.
sentences.chinese: 然後神龍大俠加入了蓋世五俠。

sentences.english: Chivalrous men in ancient times did good deeds and destroyed evil, all of them were heroes.
sentences.chinese: 古代的大俠揚善除惡，個個都是英雄豪傑。

sentences.english: I am very happy with the result of "Blood Brothers."
sentences.chinese: 我對天堂口的成績獨孤大俠六肖非常滿意。

sentences.english: Legend tells of a legendary warrior.
sentences.chinese: 傳說講的是一位傳奇大俠。

sentences.english: Let Gallant Niu lead the way.
sentences.chinese: 這裏我熟，得讓牛大俠帶路。

sentences.english: Legend tales of a legendary warrior whose kungfu skills with the stuff of legend.
sentences.chinese: 有一位傳奇中的傳奇大俠，他的功夫可謂出神入化。

definition: dangerous/sinister/vicious
to uphold justice/to be loyal (to one's friends)/to stick by
to forget favors and violate justice (idiom); ingratitude to a friend/to kick a benefactor in the teeth
beggars' union/a group of beggars
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to sneer at sb/to ridicule
(of a man) to dress as a woman (idiom)
to be obsessed/to be possessed
magnificent style unmatched in his generation (idiom); peerless talent
Roman Tam (1949-), Canto-pop singer
to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
lit. head broken and blood flowing/fig. badly bruised
to travel around the country
lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
failed and wiped over the floor (idiom); to fail utterly/a crushing defeat/beaten and in a hopeless position
lit. to hate iron for not becoming steel/to feel resentful towards sb for failing to meet expectations and impatient to see improvement (idiom)
